H0.text: In Greek mythology what was the name of the goatlike man with pointed ears, horns and a tail. Faun

H1.text: In Greek mythology what was the name of the goatlike man with pointed ears, horns and a tail. Pan

H2.text: In Greek mythology what was the name of the goatlike man with pointed ears, horns and a tail. Silenus

H3.text: In Greek mythology what was the name of the goatlike man with pointed ears, horns and a tail. Satyr

A4.text: In ancient Greek religion and mythology, Pan is the god of the wild, shepherds and flocks, rustic music and impromptus, and companion of the nymphs. He has the hindquarters, legs, and horns of a goat, in the same manner as a faun or satyr.

A5.text: In Roman religion and myth, Pan was frequently identified with Faunus, a nature god who was the father of Bona Dea, sometimes identified as Fauna; he was also closely associated with Silvanus, due to their similar relationships with woodlands, and Inuus, a vaguely defined deity also sometimes identified with Faunus.
